symptoms.name: Weakness
symptoms.severity: Severe (0/5 power in lower limbs in one case)
symptoms.pattern: Bilateral lower limb weakness, progressing to tetraparesis in some cases.  May be accompanied by tremors.

symptoms.name: Pain
symptoms.severity: Variable, from mild stinging to severe neuropathic pain
symptoms.pattern: Initially unilateral, ipsilateral to rash, later becoming bilateral.  May be localized to dermatome or more diffuse. Postherpetic neuralgia is a common complication.

symptoms.name: Sensory loss
symptoms.severity: Variable, from patchy paraesthesia to complete loss of sensation
symptoms.pattern: Loss of pain and temperature sensation in lower limbs and lower abdomen up to involved dermatome.  May affect upper limbs and trunk.  Paresthesia can be patchy.

symptoms.name: Bladder dysfunction
symptoms.pattern: Sudden onset of bladder incontinence reported in one case. Urinary retention requiring catheterization reported in another.

symptoms.name: Constipation
symptoms.pattern: Reported in one case, requiring aperients.

symptoms.name: Skin lesions
symptoms.pattern: Grouped crusted lesions on an erythematous background at the level of the involved dermatome.  May be absent in some cases.

physical_findings: Grouped crusted lesions on erythematous background
0/5 power in both lower limbs (in one case)
Complete loss of sensation (pain and temperature) over bilateral lower limbs and lower abdomen (in one case)
Muscle strength ranging from 0/5 to 4/5 in different limbs (in one case)

imaging_findings.MRI of dorsal spine: Hyperintensity on T2-weighted images, hypointense on T1-weighted images involving spinal cord from D1-D5 levels to D10-D12 levels (in one case).  High signal intensity within the left spinal cord at T2-8 (in another case). Ovoid hyperintense lesion in upper cervical spinal cord (in another case).

required: Neurological symptoms (weakness, sensory loss, bladder dysfunction) developing in temporal proximity to herpes zoster rash
MRI findings consistent with transverse myelitis
supportive: Positive VZV PCR or anti-VZV IgG in CSF

differential_diagnoses: Other neurological complications of herpes zoster
